channel.title: Tab question
channel.description: I'm trying to open the bank when the user clicks the music tab. I know how to change the interface itself, but I can't seem to find out how to let an event occur when you click the tab.. Can anyone help me with this?

item.title: Tab question
item.dc:creator: @VbCoder VbCoder
item.description:
@VbCoder wrote:

Ok, I was trying to do this completely wrong.

And you didn’t understand what I was asking q:

So… I’m trying to do this:
When the player presses the music tab (I edited it, it now has a bank symbol on it), a bank interface has to open.

Of course I know how to open the bank interface, but I can’t figure out how to know if the player presses the tab.

Normally switching tabs is all client sided, so I’ll have to let the client send something to the server when the tab is pressed.

Can someone quickly explain me how I can do this?

(Should of posted this in client help :I )

Read full topic

item.title: Tab question
item.dc:creator: @Get_Blitz Get Blitz
item.description:
@Get_Blitz wrote:

tabs don’t send a action case.

Read full topic

item.title: Tab question
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

I think it depends on what base your using. You could click the tab and look on the server file, get the case id, and add it to actionsender or something of the sort.

Ex.
case ####;
openinterface####

Something similar maybe. I suppose it just depends

Read full topic

item.title: Tab question
item.dc:creator: @Get_Blitz Get Blitz
item.description:
@Get_Blitz wrote:

it might be client.java you should see all the tab numbers somewhere and what interface you get once you click them just find te music tab i beleive its tab 13 and after once its clicked under it showInterface(interfaceid) something like that.

Read full topic
